{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is an 18-year-old woman who has recently had sexual debut with her boyfriend. She presents with a yellow-green vaginal discharge, mild pelvic and abdominal pain, cervical motion tenderness, and a pink and inflamed nulliparous cervix with small red punctate spots. A wet mount reveals numerous squamous cells and motile organisms. Given the patient's symptoms and examination findings, it is likely that she has a sexually-transmitted infection. The options are all sexually-transmitted organisms, but the presence of squamous cells on the wet mount suggests that the organism may be one that causes vaginal inflammation. This points towards Trichomonas vaginalis as the most likely cause.", "answer_choice": C}
